Name: Abatable
Summary: Defining and designing an environmental mission
Overview:
We were approached by environmental start-up Abatable to help develop a brand and guidelines on the first step of their growth journey. Abatable helps companies navigate the complexity of the voluntary carbon markets and build a credible and rigorous path to net zero through sourcing carbon projects from established registries, such as Verra's Verified Carbon Standards.

Our brief was to create a brand representing the company and its mission appropriately and clearly. The visual identity would need to be simple and impactful. Abatable is mission-driven and credible, so portraying a sense of trust was essential.

‍

‍
Our Design Thinking:
We began with a branding workshop at Shoreditch Design Studio, deep diving into the company's purpose, mission, and customer profile. Next, we began to craft how to translate this through design. The client wanted an icon/symbol rather than typography to lead the logo; therefore, our approach was iconography-led. The scientific carbon symbol is hexagonal-shaped, so we started with this as the logo's foundation. Another idea was to incorporate the letter 'Z' for Net Zero.

‍
Finished Product: We settled on a triple ribbon style Z in the shape of a hexagon, paired with a simple san serif typeface. Colour is always essential to establish an impactful brand, so we created a colour system to aid visual communication because the company produces many graphs and tables. We are delighted to report that following this piece of work, Abatable has successfully acquired funding for the next stage! Our relationship continues as we work to develop their product design on their B2B portfolio marketplace, documents and pitch decks for customers and clients. We can't wait to reveal their social media and marketing campaigns to put the company's mission front and centre in the global carbon marketplace.

Name: Accredited Labs
Summary: Building a precise and authoritative brand for Accredited Labs
Overview: Accredited Labs is setting new standards in the U.S.'s calibration industry. They needed a brand that speaks to their precision, authority, and ambitious vision of becoming international leaders in the field. The challenge was to translate that technical expertise into a visual identity that felt both trustworthy and approachable.

We designed a logo that merges a checkmark with the letter “A” to represent precision and trust. It’s the perfect blend of authority and approachability, ensuring Accredited Labs stands out with confidence. The electric green accent adds a sharp edge, setting the brand apart in an otherwise understated industry.

To keep it versatile, we created a secondary logo—‘A-Labs’—to communicate speed and efficiency. The colour palette of White Slate, Charcoal Black, and Electric Green is bold yet professional, with stainless steel and pewter grey adding a sleek, sophisticated touch.Our custom icon set embraces sharp, geometric lines, reflecting the brand’s focus on precision. High-contrast, monochrome imagery adds intensity, using light and shadow to emphasise the strength and sophistication of their products.

These shapes are used throughout the site to enhance the user experience, creating a visually engaging and intuitive navigation system. The result is a modern, confident brand identity, paired with a sleek digital presence that positions Accredited Labs as a forward-thinking leader in calibration, focused on precision and ready to grow across the U.S.A.

Name: Air Traffic Control
Summary: The world's first marketing personalisation app powered by Ai
Overview: Air traffic control is a first-of-its kind marketing platform that brings machine learning to the hands of marketers. By seamlessly integrating popular marketing tools like HubSpot and Mailchimp with their advanced AI capabilities, marketers have the ability to accurately generate interest tags for each individual contact in a mailing list, ensuring personalized and engaging content recommendations tailored to their specific preferences.By leveraging the intelligence of AI, ATC enables businesses to unlock valuable insights about their customers, create highly effective marketing campaigns that resonate with their audience, drive meaningful interactions, and boost conversions.
Our Design Thinking:
Brand: When developing ATC's brand, our goal was to establish a bold and approachable image that resonated with the company's down-to-earth and no-nonsense nature while also showcasing the power of its technology. In light of the AI boom, we consciously opted to steer clear of the typical glossy and high-tech aesthetic. Instead, we carefully selected a fun and personable colour palette that directly appealed to our target audience: real people facing genuine marketing challenges.

Platform: Our design thinking for the platform revolved around creating a user-centric experience that seamlessly blends human intuition with advanced technological understanding. We prioritized the needs and goals of the users, which range from marketers to business owners, and aimed to design a platform that is intuitive, user-friendly, and efficient, enabling marketers to leverage the power of AI without feeling overwhelmed. With AI doing the heavy lifting behind the scenes, the platform itself became a powerful reporting tool. Allowing marketers to effortlessly evaluate the performance of their content pieces, gain valuable insights into audience relevance, and receive recommendations for content topics that engage their viewers. Additionally, it allows marketers to track their competitors’ content and marketing performance against their own.One of the key challenges we faced was ensuring users made the connection between the work of AI and the data presented on the platform. We recognized the importance of striking a balance between simplicity and ease of use while also ensuring users understood the underlying complexity of the technology driving ATC. To tackle this challenge, we implemented a meticulously designed onboarding process.
Finished Product: In just a 3-month sprint, we successfully created a fresh and innovative brand that embodies the friendly, no-nonsense tone of the company.A sleek web app that equips users with data and tools to generate new content that specifically appeals to their target audience.An exciting onboarding process that showcased the vast possibilities and power of using ATC and drove users to sign up. After sign-up, following the initial excitement, a detailed first-time user experience was created that guided users through the product’s reporting tools and bridged the gap between AI technology and the data on the platform.A compelling sales website that captivates users' interests. By incorporating live demos, we effectively communicated the value and functionality of the product, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.

Name: Anywhere
Summary: Anywhere is better than an estate agent
Overview: Anywhere is a new platform with the aim of making moving house epically easy. They wanted to be the leading marketplace for buying and selling property in the UK (at least for starters).Targeting homeowners who want to sell or buy their house with speed and certainty rather than stress and worry, they were looking for a mass-market brand to appeal to a wide range of potential users. They came to us to help them build their new brand and first website from scratch.
Our Design Thinking:
Buying or selling a house is an awful experience. 35% of all property transactions fail and the process is often as stressful as divorce.

Anywhere have re-designed the process from the ground up. Buyers or sellers get their keys or their money within 30 days of the offer being accepted. Everybody has a digital-first, certain experience with no fall-through, no gazumping and no fuss.

In order to best deliver its message to the market, Anywhere needed a brand with wide appeal, self-assurance and a clear, bold mission.

We started by researching the other big players in the online property space. This gave us a good sense of what works and what doesn’t, while also making sure we knew how to stand out in a crowded market.

We then experimented with typography and iconography, playing with the ideas of home, security, movement and selling amongst others. Once a logomark, colour scheme and basic rules for typography were agreed we knew we were in a great place to move forward with designing a fresh, bright and accessible website.
Finished Product:
As we began developing ideas for the website the brand evolved further alongside it. We introduced “swooshes”, “swirls” and “squiggles” as a metaphor for the speed and ease of moving house to house by using Anywhere. These brand elements helped breathe life and movement into the landing pages and other collateral which allowed us to experiment with photography and motion in unique ways with a lot of potential for future growth.
Our rebrand for Anywhere can be seen across their website and social media platforms, as they redefine the house hunt market.

Name: BrewDog Black Heart
Summary: A video advertisement that takes on redefining our perception of stout
Overview: To launch their first-ever headliner stout, we worked with the team at BrewDog to create an animation that played with the idea of why a new stout could be better than the famous black stuff you usually drink. The tagline for their campaign was: It wasn't created in 1759, but what if it's better?
Our Design Thinking: To expand on this, we thought of all the ways we have progressed since 1759 in food, hygiene and everything else. It doesn't take too much research to see that life back then, while nostalgic in the imagination, was pretty grim. We got to work writing a script and storyboard where, the main crux of the video is the contrast between the year the world's most famous stout was created and the modern era in which BrewDog's Black Heart was created. We came up with a few things in the animation to illustrate this and contrasted it with Black Heart: shiny, new and tasty. This was the first project where we created the can and glass entirely in CGI - this gave us complete control and a perfect finish. We also used kinetic type to show that Black Heart is a stout made in and for this century.
Finished Product: The videos we produced for Black Heart align with the style we have set out through the Alcohol-Free range videos, limited colour palette, block colours, and a focus on clear and crisp footage of the product. The videos are being used as a part of the broader campaign for the beer, where Brewdog has been doing blind taste tests against Guinness, taking it on tour in Ireland and other fun and controversial marketing.

Name: BrewDog Planet Pale
Summary: Elevating our animation process for Brewdog’s Planet Pale
Overview: For our latest installation of BrewDog work, the brief was to create a promo for Planet Pale. We took this project as a chance to experiment with how 3D rendering could complement real footage of the product. As this was the second time we rendered the cans using 3D, the technique and workflow improved and the results were even better than the first. It felt like it opened a new door to what could be possible within our usual workflow.
Our Design Thinking:
This project we knew was aimed primarily at draught drinkers and for use in the BrewDog Bars. In the early storyboarding phase, we were thinking about how to grab visual attention in a bar setting. Designer Ryan Knight recalls, "Two things instantly came to mind; bright colours, and snappy transitions."

This is where the video sets itself apart from the prior series, where before scenes would blend into each other and have complex transitions. Here we made use of hard cuts - jumping from vibrant colour to colour, grabbing the eye even in a crowded bar. We used “Juicy” shots frequently, for example, the falling cans shot at the start, a visually pleasing gradient, next to 2 other pleasing gradients, then repeating cans floating in this space, all graded to look bright and mouthwatering. Even the grade on the in-bar shots was done to darken the bar and make it look like a traditional pub, making the liquid vibrant and mouthwatering.

We did a two-day shoot on location of the BrewDog bar atmosphere, capturing the context and textures of the beer pours from the tap.
Finished Product: The finished result is an elevation from our previous BrewDog work. The combination of processes and use of CGI cans and elements helped push the content forward into the current possibilities in the animation world. Thanks to the new workflow and use of 3D rendered cans, the complete range of visually appealing shots is done with easier production, lower render time and smaller file sizes. The final video stands out in a bar and grabs the eye with its juicy colours and mouth-watering shots.

Name: Estrid x the Romans
Summary: Graphic design for a campaign that breathes diversity and natural body hair into classic Renaissance paintings
Overview:
Estrid is a Swedish-based shaving subscription that delivers a high-quality, beautifully designed and inclusive range of shaving products made to last. Their fun and graphic marketing have led them to grow a steady consumer base, and they keep growing! With a solid creative team that generates big ideas, their PR company, the Romans, reached out to Shoreditch Design to help realise the artwork for their latest campaign idea.

They envisioned reimagining classical Renaissance paintings with their diverse body ambassadors and showcasing where each chooses to grow body hair. This was a rich opportunity to help address unrealistic beauty ideals set out by traditional painters, who notoriously painted bodies to make them look more "perfect" with grossly exaggerated muscles on men and distorting the curves on feminine subjects in an anatomically impossible way.
Our Design Thinking:
The brief handed over to us set out nine traditional paintings by a variety of acclaimed painters in the Renaissance, such as Michelangelo and Botticelli. The client then paired their ambassadors with a painting, and with guidance from us, the models shot their own content. In the ever-changing advertising landscape, "influencer" at-home shot content is becoming more common.

This presents its own set of challenges regarding getting the lighting consistent and working with varying qualities of light and image. This project required a bit of experimentation and work to get it right. We worked to balance enough manipulation of the photo so that the model sank into the painting while trying to keep their natural features, such as stretch marks, skin colouring, and body hair, as untouched as possible. Ultimately, we opted to apply painterly effects to areas of fabric and edges of the photographs. Some paintings required more background manipulation to ensure that the model looked like it belonged in that setting as much as the original subject.
Finished Product:
In the end, we reached a style that our team and the client were thrilled with. The final set of nine images was carefully crafted to seamlessly place the model into the painting.

Estrid used these images to build an online exhibition (see below) and also hosted an IRL exhibition and celebration of the campaign's launch in Berlin! They complimented the paintings with a gorgeous serif font and glyphs. We are excited to see how Estrid has used the artwork from the campaign as posters around Stockholm, the celebration in Berlin, and globally shared on social media.
‍

The campaign was a large success - and got featured in numerous online publications, including an article by Glamour claiming it was done by AI (spoiler alert - it wasn't).

Name: Jota
Summary: Keep hold of what matters to you with innovative link-saving app, Jota
Overview:
At Shoreditch Design, we support our designers when they have an innovative product idea. One of our own, Noa Peeters, came up with the exciting concept for a new app to innovate how we save website links.

In the digital age, where most information sharing happens over mobile devices, keeping track of the links that matter to you can be challenging. If you're like most people, you probably have many links saved in various places - on your computer, in your email, and maybe even in a few different browser tabs. That's where Jota comes in; no more wasted time searching for old links. With Jota, everything is just a click away, and Jota makes it easy to share links with friends and family. So whether you're looking for a new recipe or planning your next vacation, Jota has you covered. You can categorise your links by subject so you can easily find them again later. Paste links within the app with one tap, or add them from your browser. Jota provides a contemporary solution to collating information in the modern era.
Our Design Thinking:
After she came up with the initial idea and was given the green light, Noa and her team delved into researching the existing link-saving models. The research phase was crucial in establishing the shortcomings of current link-saving models, such as "bookmark tabs" and existing apps. Next was a phase of fearless visual experimentation to optimise the user interface and experience of the app design.

The homepage is simplified with two main areas, your general collection and the categories page. The 'general collection' shows all the links you've saved to the app and features a search bar + tags to immediately identify the category. The categories page provides specific links based on their labels, such as 'summer trip to Rome' or 'London Restaurants'. This significantly paired-down layout achieves the user-friendly simplicity the team was after. She worked with the Impresset development team to build the app and undergo user testing, ensuring optimal functionality.
Finished Product:
The design result is a practical, considered interface that fills a gap in the market. The app is currently undergoing its first round of marketing + advertising since the initial IOS launch, and Shoreditch Design couldn't be more excited to support Noa & her team in gaining momentum for Jota! We are all collectors, sharers and curators and keep hold of what matters to you. Give it a try now, and never waste time searching for a link again!

Their technology stress-tests products like chatbots and voice assistants to ensure top-notch quality, resilience, and user experience. To match their forward-thinking innovation, MAIHEM needed a brand identity and website that could showcase their expertise and attract a growing audience.

When MAIHEM came to us, they needed more than a new look; they needed a brand identity as bold as their vision. We crafted a dynamic, human-centred identity that brings their story to life. Name: MoneySavingPro

MoneySavingPro analyses the top competitors along with smaller providers such as T-Mobile, At&t, Verizon and MintMobile so that their users get the best deals on the market and, ultimately, save money. They were looking for a brand refresh and complete site redesign to boost their presence in the industry and bring more traffic to the site.

Name: Mosaic
Summary: Bringing a hint of the Amalfi coast to a menswear logo + icon
Overview: Mosaic is a new fashion block kid specialising in classic men's trousers. They are in the initial phases of their brand and came to us looking for the foundational elements of a brand to help establish their identity. The brief was for a timeless and classic logo and wordmark that immediately invoked a sense of luxury and quality.
Our Design Thinking:
One of the client's requests was to evoke the Nostalgia and calm ambience of the Almafi coast. Their brand ethos is that "it's easier to be yourself when you're relaxed".

We used the symbolism behind their name as the base inspiration for our visuals. Mosaics are a unique blend of art and home décor prominent during antiquity in the Mediterranean and North African regions. Their decorative and vibrant stone and glass tiles came together to tell stories of life, spirituality and beauty. Roman mosaics served as a backdrop to opulent times as a symbol of wealth and status.

The team worked to develop a classic serifed wordmark with timeless appeal. We developed that sense of relaxation and luxury through a palette influenced by lounging in the sun on the Med, with vibrant orange and sea foam blue as primary colours.

‍
Finished Product: We created a strong logo icon and word mark with a set of colour, imagery and logo guidelines. We helped the founders visualise their brand coming to fruition through a series of mock-ups which provide a strong vision of how these guidelines could be used to make a strong impact in the fashion world.

Name: Muzz
Summary: Rebrand and product design for the leading dating app for Muslim singles
Overview: In the 21st century, there’s no shame in online + app dating! However, it can still be challenging to meet someone you feel compatible with, and in a largely secular culture, it’s even harder to find someone who shares the same religious values. This is where the idea for Muzz (formerly Muzzmatch) was formed. Muzz pairs Muslim singles based on shared values and priorities with the goal of marriage. With over 4 million users and 25,000 marriages from Muzmatch, it is the place to go to find a halal partner for life.
Our Design Thinking:
We wanted to illustrate the joy and butterflies you feel when you’ve found the one through our branding proposition. We embodied this through Vibrant colours, playful illustrations and the choice of font.

From a UI perspective, we wanted app users to feel safe, respected and comfortable enough to be themselves, so we ensured a clean and clear web flow. With the UX, we rethought the whole product and browsing interaction to increase matches and that initial conversation. We also introduced a suite of new features such as video calling. Shoreditch filled in those finishing touches to make Muzz a top-performing App.
Finished Product:
The team at Shoreditch really embraced the love with our choices in colour palette, logo and icons to enhance Muzz’s incentives of a match that ends in marriage.

Since the rebrand by Shoreditch Studio, Muzz has staked its place as the top choice for Muslim singles. During our tenure as lead designers on the project, we saw the user base double in size and helped it gain popularity internationally.

Name: NHS Virtually
Summary: Upgrading an online NHS consultation and health platform
Overview:
In early 2021, SDS was commissioned by NHS Virtually to overhaul its online consultation platform.

The Virtually platform was created to help primarily London and metropolitan areas of the UK to more effectively deal with a high demand for GP appointments, a situation hugely exacerbated by the COVID pandemic. It was clear that the platform needed to better appeal to users, and be generally easier to use for practitioners and the general public.

‍
Our Design Thinking:
The challenge was to create an all-encompassing consultation and health platform.

Initially we knew we could revive the pre-existing platform with a UI overhaul, still sticking with the recognised Virtually NHS colours, but using them in a way that gave a softer and more comforting feel to the medical platform.

Alongside this UI overhaul, we revised the UX of the platform to make it easier to use for all regardless of age, language or disability. Using trending UX techniques, our mission was to create a platform that seemed intuitive to even the most unknowledgeable of users. 

‍
Finished Product:
The GP express service enables the user to have a walk-in consultation with a specially trained pharmacist and leave the pharmacy with prescription medication.

We identified key areas to best aid in this user experience by informing the user of the new service and their goal completion. With the help of Shoreditch Studio, the NHS Virtually service was launched with smooth and clean visuals, which helped improve the useability of the App.

Name: Noli
Summary: UI/UX inspired by Nordic design for apartment app, Noli
Overview:
Noli is an app for a serviced apartment company in Helsinki & Vantaa in Finland. Noli Studios helps connect professionals with short or long-term stays with contemporary Scandi interiors and plenty of areas for socialising, co-working, and relaxing. Their tagline is ‘we give you the comforts of home with the amenities of a hotel.
We connected through our client Res-Harmonics, who work with Noli Studios. Res delivered the software and supported sales & operations, and we helped tie everything together with the existing Noli branding and designed the App itself. They approached shoreditch to expand and design the App's UI & UX.
Our Design Thinking: Since we had the framework of parts of the App already made, we focused on expanding and building out specific features like booking meeting rooms, extra visits from the cleaners, and extra amenities. We also helped develop an in-app door key to their studio, a messaging area so you can speak to the maintenance team and book repairs, and a guide to the building and local area. We helped expand their service to include everything a guest in the building might need.
Finished Product:
There are a lot of features to tie together, so this project was about making navigation super simple to help make it as easy as possible for the users to make the most of their stay with Noli. Noli is all about making their tenants feel as at home as possible, so inevitable tasks such as booking a repair or an extra cleaning needed to be seamless so that you can focus on enjoying your stay in Helsinki.

We delivered an MVP with a contemporary Scandinavian feel that fits perfectly with the Noli Studio brand and experience.

Name: North Equity
Summary: Pitchdeck for venture equity firm
Overview: North Equity is a venture equity firm that builds, cultivates and scales transformative digital media brandsWe were approached by them to design a pitchdeck for clients and companies they could potentially invest in.
Our Design Thinking: We began this process by researching their current look and feel through their social media and website since we weren't provided with style guidelines. Our goal was to adapt their concept and style throughout the pitch deck without looking too branded since it would be directed towards other companies that could potentially be part of their acquisitions.
Finished Product: By using a limited colour palette, different backgrounds corresponding to each type of slide (text, quotes, graphs, etc.) and adding slight textures, we achieved the serious look and feel we were going for.However, to also make it look appealing and maintain the public’s interest, we adapted the image treatment they use on their website (duotone and with a dollar bill style) to the assets we created for them to appear throughout the presentation.

Name: Northwind
Summary: Timeless brand and digital experience for aviation lovers
Overview:
Northwind is more than an aviation archive—it’s a celebration of craftsmanship, history, and storytelling. Their mission to capture the spirit of vintage aviation through iconic aircraft and curated tales inspired a digital design as timeless as the planes they fly.

Northwind needed a cohesive identity that would bridge their storytelling, journal, and aircraft showcase. The challenge was to craft a brand as bespoke as their vision and build a website that brought their stories to life.

‍

We began with the brand, designing a visual identity rooted in timeless elegance and subtle sophistication. This foundation carried through into the website, which we tailored to feel bespoke and engaging. From classic typography to refined colour palettes, every design decision was made to evoke a sense of history and craftsmanship.

The website’s clean architecture and bespoke details—like 3D imagery, subtle animations, and curated layouts—mirror the brand’s values. It serves as both a digital archive and a storytelling platform, ensuring every interaction feels purposeful and unique.

‍
Finished Product: Northwind’s brand and website now work together seamlessly, offering a cohesive experience that captures their dedication to storytelling and craftsmanship. The result? A digital presence that elevates their voice and engages a growing audience of aviation enthusiasts.

Name: NZXT

Overview: NZXT is a computer insurance company specialising in components and pre-built gaming PCs. They came to us looking for a comprehensive icon library to help distinguish and highlight the hardware they had on offer.

Name: Oddsjam Original
Summary: The smartest betting software on the market
Overview: OddsJam is an innovative solution designed by Stanford engineers to identify mathematically profitable betting opportunities, using the fastest real-time data to help users beat the books. With significant earnings on offer, OddsJam required a new brand and interface as sleek as the science behind it to attract new subscribers.

Oddsjam’s current branding was dated, and as a premium service, achieving a cohesive and slick feel was essential to instil trust with new and existing users. Shoreditch Design sought to update and evolve Oddsjam with a consistent component library and clear and direct user flows.

With significant earnings on offer, OddsJam required an interface that was as smart as the science behind it to attract new subscribers.

We updated the UI to give it a sleek, contemporary appearance that increased excitement and made it simple to identify the best bets to place. This was achieved by switching the platform's default colour system to dark mode. By opting for dark mode, we prioritised user comfort, aesthetic appeal, and thematic alignment, ultimately enriching the overall user experience of the platform.

Simplicity was a key factor as this app uses high levels of complex information. We needed to make sure the user journey through the app was easy to use and navigate through. Our approach incorporated principles of usability and accessibility to deliver a seamless and engaging experience.
Finished Product: The introduction of dark mode was a popular choice among users, increasing user engagement and brand consistency. The intuitive design elements and seamless navigation pathways allowed smoother interactions, resulting in higher engagement with the platform.

Name: Once
Summary: App design + marketing campaigns for Once, the dating app that offers you quality, not quantity
Overview: Once is making an impact by being the first dating app to match you with compatible people based on a comprehensive emotional profile. Their goal is for their users to have relationship success rather than play games, so you receive one high-quality match per day. Their compatibility algorithm based on mutual interests and values aims to create more meaningful matches. We worked closely with the founders over 18 months on a total redesign of this dating app and produced video marketing campaigns.
Our Design Thinking:
The first stage of this project was to understand the brand's values and core and what they were coming to the market with that made them stand out. We continued our research with a deep dive into the user personas to ensure every design decision aligned with brand and user needs.

The result was a playful interface that allows users to input their interests and hobbies when signing up to let the app do the work for them. This means you can focus on your life and day rather than swiping + being presented with one great match a day.

In addition to a complete App redesign, we produced multiple marketing campaigns designed to increase sign-ups! The video campaigns provided an excellent opportunity for Shoreditch Design's production + video team to focus on storytelling.
Finished Product: Following the relaunch of the app featuring our designs, Once was successfully acquired by a larger dating group for a reported sum of $18 million. The app has glowing reviews from influential lifestyle magazines such as Vanity Fair, Elle and Glamour. And most importantly, it continues to help its users find love.

Name: Onform
Summary: Product design for video analysis sports app Onform
Overview: Onform is a US-based iOS and Android app used by coaches and athletes worldwide to record and analyse their performance and technique. Used across multiple sports, from baseball to swimming, the app allows coaches to annotate, compare and coach their teams during and after the session. We worked with the founders to construct their visual brand and design their product.

Summary: Visual identity with a breath of fresh air

Ophelos is transforming debt collection with tech that actually listens to people. Their approach? Understand the customer, build trust, and reclaim debt—simple.

They don't just help companies recover debts—they give people a real chance to take control of their financial health. And it's working. They've helped large U.K.-based companies, such as Octopus, reclaim outstanding debts effectively.

With a clear vision but no brand to match, Ophelos turned to us for a visual identity that truly communicated their passion and mission.
Our Design Thinking:
We worked closely with the Ophelos team to refresh their brand and redesign their website, ensuring it aligned with their values and recent growth.

We transformed their visual identity to connect with both customers and businesses, keeping their values intact. Our design approach centred around their commitment to innovation, integrity, and financial empowerment.

The customer palette draws on the moment sunlight breaks through the clouds, warming the world in golden light—evoking hope and the motivation to start fresh.

We introduced cool blues and dawn-inspired tones for business audiences to symbolise stability and trust, reinforcing Ophelos' tech-driven approach to debt resolution. This choice of colours instils confidence in the tech behind Ophelos' approach to the debt resolution process, making businesses feel more at ease.

By focusing on human-centric, accessible design, we achieved a cohesive digital experience that reflected Ophelos' core values and mission and resonated emotionally with its users. Our work on a unified digital presence strengthened Ophelos' connection with business and consumer audiences, reinforcing their brand identity and driving greater trust and engagement.

Name: Otto

Name: Oxford Properties
Summary: Complete website restructure for Oxford Properties
Overview:
Oxford Properties is a global real estate investor, asset manager, and developer with end-to-end expertise in strengthening economies and communities. With over eight offices worldwide, their services reach all corners of the earth. To support these ever-expanding audiences, Oxford Properties needed a solid website.

The website has two essential functions. One is to provide property seekers with a user-friendly platform to buy or rent in their preferred area - this requires a user-friendly search feature and clean UI + intuitive UX. The second function is to showcase the company's influence as a stepping stone for investors to contact.  

Our mission was to find points of intersection between these two user groups, identify and address pain points in the user journey, and achieve consistency and balance among the brand guidelines with different visual tones for these different We started by researching all the interaction details to understand the users, their needs, and the problem the design was trying to solve

When users explore real estate options, they want to ensure the financial stability and reliability of the company (Krasnopeev, "Fabrika Gipotez"). Our key points of improvement were core communication, search process and navigation. The second part of our research involved analysing competitors, which allowed us to gain a more precise understanding of integrating intriguing features into the client's new website.

For the visual aesthetic, it was important to take cohesive yet tonally different approaches for the Investor pages vs the Real Estate pages. We created a very adaptable design library that can be customised to any industry using standard blocks, giving each sector uniqueness with a colour palette and combining fonts. Tailoring colour and typography choices enhances user engagement and aligns with each audience's preferences and objectives.

‍
Finished Product:
In the end we created a very adaptable design library that can be customised to any industry using standard blocks, giving each sector uniqueness with a colour palette and combining fonts.

The site's two- tone approach maximises performance and key results while keeping the brand cohesive and minimal; ensuring we convert and impress at the same time.

Penfold empowers its customers to take control of their future with their flexible, modern & faff-free pension platform. Name: Powermarket
Summary: Powering the switch to community solar with Powermarket
Overview: Powermarket is a community solar platform that allows Americans to switch to clean energy from shared farms. Overview: Prospyr provides aesthetic practices with a single, easy-to-use platform with all the practice management tools clinicians need. They centralise everything from bookings, records and notes to social media integration to help a business grow. We helped design their SaaS (Software as a service) product directly with their development team. We also refined their marketing site and expanded their component library.
Our Design Thinking: We used a clean medical aesthetic and relied on an adaptable design system. The colour palette is soothing and trustworthy with teal, sky blue and an accent orange. We flexed our creative ability on novel UX functionality and architecture suggestions to simplify aesthetic clinicians' jobs.
Finished Product: We integrated with Prospyr's team for several months, where we designed and released a bundle of features. We also released their marketing site. Healthtech is one of our niches, and we were able to test our knowledge and make the most of past wisdom of health-based admin panels, meaning faster turnarounds and better results for the Prospyr team. If you have a health tech project, get in touch to see how we can perfect your product.

Name: Protectivity
Summary: Protectivity brand and website makeover
Overview:
The Protectivity team reached out to Shoreditch Design with two goals: a complete brand update and a complete user experience rehaul. The result needed to be visually appealing and easy for users to interact with.

Our first step was to define a brand identity in order to build a website that could encompass the aesthetic we had created.

‍
Our Design Thinking:
We initially focused on researching the insurance industry and related sectors to understand which organisations were succeeding and which needed to catch up.

An in-person workshop provided valuable insights into the image Protectivity wanted a brand that was approachable and friendly but still had the reliable and established balance needed in insurance.

With this in mind, we crafted the brand's essential elements: the logo, colour scheme, and typography. Through several iterations, we refined a cohesive and well-thought-out aesthetic perfectly aligned with Protectivity's ethos.

From there, we developed a comprehensive set of components and brand assets that embodied our core brand identity. The result was a meticulously crafted design system ready to be implemented across all touch points.
Finished Product:
The final Protectivity product stands out and showcases its unique offering.

The outcome of our collaboration with Protectivity included a website featuring a bold and contemporary aesthetic that challenges the norms of a traditionally conservative industry. The site is vibrant and colourful across hundreds of pages, ensuring a genuinely enjoyable user experience, unlike typical interactions with insurance products.

Check out their live site today: https://www.protectivity.com/

Name: Pub Collector
Summary: Our very own app for tracking and planning pub crawls
Overview: For those that know Shoreditch, you will be aware we love the pub! So in our spare time, we decided to make a new app that lets you track, review and plan your pub nights out. We love to test our own skills by building and launching our own products. Pub Collector was an excellent opportunity to experiment with new technologies, like our pub crawl planning algorithm and a chance for us to refine our internal processes and knowledge.
Our Design Thinking: As our accountant keeps telling us, we spend too much time in the pub. So we know a thing or two about where the best ones in Shoreditch are. The goal of this app, though, was to make sure no matter where you were in the world (we have dozens of countries covered), you could find the best pub closest to you. We are very keen to add social elements too, so within  Pub Collector, you can see where your friends have been frequenting, send them a cheers and plan pub crawls together.
Finished Product:
The app has thousands of active users and a 4.6 rating on the app store. We have an Android app in the works but have been too busy to release it. The most successful metric is that some of our users have been to over 1,000 pubs! Our team is doing its best to catch up...

Name: Q Apartments
Summary: Product design for the future of long-term rentals with Q apartments
Overview: Q apartments is a property rental company with thousands of apartments available worldwide. We worked with them to create a new product and website for their prime website and subsidiaries. Their primary offering is Q apartments, which offers business employees flexible rental options for corporate travel; we redesigned their complete product and site. We created the visuals for their holiday offering Morii and their parent company Q International Group's websites.
Our Design Thinking: Q apartments is a property rental company with thousands of apartments available worldwide. We worked with them to create a new product and website for their prime website and subsidiaries. Their primary offering is Q apartments, which offers business employees flexible rental options for corporate travel; we redesigned their complete product and site. We also conceived their holiday offering Morii and their parent company Q International Group's websites.
Finished Product:
In a quick-fire project, we delivered 3 unique, branded websites and products ready for development over a few months. Using the leading UX best practices for booking and purchase flows we helped the Q apartments team deliver the ultimate experience. This project reflects the breadth and adaptability of our services and how we can expand a single company's different ideas.

Name: Qrone
Summary: Motion design for the future of networking
Overview: Qrone came to us with a vision: to transform the traditional business card into a dynamic digital touchpoint. Our mission? Position their digital business card platform as a high-end, future-forward solution that appeals to modern professionals, preserving the elegance of traditional networking.
Our Design Thinking:
Our creative strategy embraced the platform’s sophistication, blending high-end 3D renders with polished 2D animation. Rich, dark colour palettes and dramatic lighting underscored Qrone’s premium appeal, while seamless transitions reflected its effortless user experience.

Each scene highlighted key interactions—from NFC card taps to instant profile sharing—illustrating how Qrone elevates networking by removing traditional barriers and providing a comprehensive digital solution.

‍
Finished Product: The result was a striking video that positions Qrone at the crossroads of premium technology and accessible networking. We crafted a narrative that bridges classic networking values with digital innovation, establishing Qrone as an aspirational brand for today’s professionals.

Name: Quantum Workplace
Summary: Promotional marketing video for HR SaaS tool Quantum Workplace
Overview: Quantum Workplace is a US tech company that develops innovative software for the HR market. We helped Quantum workplace develop their product vision and formulise it in a video to inspire their internal team.
Our Design Thinking: We wanted to showcase various features across their product suite and pull them together in a slick viewer experience.
Finished Product: We helped Quantum Workplace plan product development for the next 5 years and inspire their team.

Name: Qube
Summary: A Multifaceted Wordmark for AI e-Trading Software, Qube
Overview:
Qube is a new software development tool to help build customisable e-trading platforms. Their framework enables rapid prototyping and developing a sophisticated and customisable electronic trading solution. With a digital product that provides solutions with code and AI at the top of the game - Qube needed a dynamic new brand. They approached Shoreditch Design looking to up their game with a complete visual rebrand and a new website.

‍
Our Design Thinking: We worked to play on their name, "Qube", and create a logo that embodies their service and has multiple uses within the brand's assets. We developed a series of shapes pulled from the typography in the word mark, and these shapes can be combined in various combinations and colours. After creating the structure behind the brand's visuals, we created a series of assets: LinkedIn banners, post templates, email signatures, and more. Using colours and shapes, each of these assets embodies the brand's clean + bold aesthetic.

Name: RailsRocket
Overview: RailsRocket gives people with an idea for an App but no coding experience and the tools and framework to build a functional app from scratch. Like Squarespace, it empowers those with a business or product to build things themselves. The no-code SaaS & business app builder RailsRocket is an easy-to-use, no-code platform for creating custom business apps backed by actual Rails code. We've helped them with both their website and pitch decks to increase funding.
Our Design Thinking: In a design sprint that lasted only a few days, the team at shoreditch came up with a landing page and an MVP product. We kept the design clean and neat, so we employed their vibrant purple and some other strong colours to keep things interesting. As a software development tool, we wanted to stray from the framework of traditional developer tools, which can feel overly serious and boring. So we designed the tool to be colourful and fun for the user to enjoy their app-building experience.
Finished Product: As a start-up initiative, our work with RailsRocket has helped launch into the market with a strong visual presence. Our pitch deck designs were used for investor pitches, which enabled the start-up to secure more funding for its next stage. As App + UI/UX Designers, it's great to see a product like RailsRocket open the doors to businesses and individuals without the resources to hire an external agency. We love to see the impact our designs make with start-ups and look forward to seeing the company grow!

Name: Recco
Summary: Design for the company that's simplifying and innovating the retail energy market
Overview: RECCo are an independent, proactive, and forward-looking non-profit company set up to simplify, improve, and facilitate innovation in the Retail Energy Market. We partnered with RECCo to create a meaningful identity reflecting the company's informed yet forward-thinking nature.
Our Design Thinking: Working closely with the team at RECCo, through a series of workshops, we gathered a better understanding of the characteristics and emotions associated with the brand. We swiftly learnt that a classic but future-led aesthetic was the key. This duality forms many themes across the visual identity, from muted and bright colours in the palette to the pairing of traditional serifs with bold modern fonts.
Finished Product: The RECCo brand has been fully reworked, using the missions and values that the company holds dear. The visual identity has been brought up to modern standards with a punchy new logo and colour palette. Whilst standing out in the crowded energy market, it also portrays the strong values of integrity and innovation within RECCo. We further expanded the new identity into the digital output, in the form of a new website and interactive documents, which have been built from the ground up. Leaning into accessibility and ease-of-use, the new digital touch-points have been built to streamline communications; allowing RECCo to edit out the bumf, and get to action.

Name: RegTrail
Summary: Modern product design for news & insights platform
Overview:
The market is in unprecedented times regarding regulation changes; it can take time for businesses of all sizes to keep up. Manually scanning different news platforms takes time and resources.

RegTrail fills a necessary gap in the market - providing curated regulatory news & insights for the energy and commodity community. The web platform aims to deliver the most important news to your email to save you time and offer convenience. They keep you up to date and ensure you get the complete picture of regulator updates from hundreds of sources.

The founder of RegTrail reached out to us to develop a platform that aesthetically and functionally met their mission of creating an accessible and intuitive platform. Our primary goal was to craft a direct user route and experience.
Our Design Thinking: The client turned to our expertise in establishing effective communication with the target customer. Therefore, our objective was to research the user path's best possibilities. First, we worked out the user flow and architecture of the product's experience. Then we developed a visual style and palette reflecting a clean, clear, forward-thinking product. After deciding on the core visual elements, geometric solid shapes featuring a subtle blue gradient and glass morphic icons, we expanded these elements into a fully-fledged design system and applied them to the low-fidelity screens.
Finished Product:
The end product empowers the user by delivering custom-tailored insights to their inbox.

We guided the client in selecting the most crucial scenarios throughout the user journey design stage and concentrated on these components in the design. The platform is user-friendly, intelligible, and visually appealing. Without sacrificing the integrity of the user path, we added several intriguing graphical solutions. The client claims that many consumers wanted to embrace the platform's new format right away during the design phase.

Check out a live demo of the product today: https://www.regtrail.com/

Name: Synthetic matter
Summary: Reimagining synthetic materials to elevate digital experiences
Overview: For this project, we created AI-generated 3D assets for clients across industries like cybersecurity, healthcare, and data analytics. These decorative elements, used on splash screens and web pages, were designed to elevate their digital presence with minimal effort.Using tools like MidJourney, Firefly, and Runway, we tailored each design to match the brand’s unique voice. For example, we crafted softer materials and calming tones for a healthcare client looking to convey trust and tranquility. In contrast, a tech startup in cybersecurity received sleek, sophisticated visuals aligned with their cutting-edge brand. By referencing real-world materials and textures, the AI-generated assets felt authentic and visually striking.
Finished Product: We provided a range of 3D assets, including high-resolution splash screens with neon glow effects for cybersecurity, and soft-focus, ambient occlusion textures for healthcare sites. For a game app, we developed playful, animated 3D onboarding assets that enhanced user engagement. Tech startups received landing page assets rendered with low-poly modeling and realistic shading techniques.

Name: ResortPass
Summary: Helping ResortPass with a design system to roll out their rebrand
Overview:
ResortPass operates as both a B2B and B2C business, partnering with hotels to offer day access to their amenities, including pools, spas, and workspaces. On the B2C side, ResortPass empowers locals and traveler's to effortlessly book luxurious hotel amenities for just a single day.

With ResortPass, users gain exclusive daytime access to the world’s finest hotels, enjoying premium features such as pools, spas, and cabanas, all without needing to book an overnight stay. ResortPass is at the forefront of creating a brand-new category in hospitality, redefining how people experience luxury and relaxation.

The brief was to refresh ResortPass's current product look and feel while creating a robust, responsive design system for their internal team to roll out seamlessly. This involved documenting design rules and usage for both the B2B and B2C sides, ensuring the system adapts across various breakpoints, products, and programming languages.
Our Design Thinking:
We began by exploring various design directions for the primary product pages across both the B2B and B2C platforms, focusing on defining a fresh colour palette, typography, graphic treatments, and overall style.

Once the direction was signed off, we began rolling out the design system components, rigorously stress-testing them to ensure a consistent and cohesive user experience across all products. We worked closely with the ResortPass team to gain a deep understanding of their customers and product, ensuring the best possible outcome for the design system and rebrand.

During the file handovers, we provided detailed guidance on setting up new colours and variations, equipping the team with the confidence and knowledge to update and maintain the design system moving forward.
Finished Product:
We are incredibly proud of the design system we created, leveraging the latest features in Figma to maximise its capabilities and deliver a modern, efficient solution.

The ResortPass team were thrilled with the results and have enjoyed seamlessly rolling out their product using the new Design System.

Name: Responsibly
Summary: Product design for a spreadsheet-free sustainable supply chain
Overview: Responsibly is an automated supplier data and evaluation platform based in Copenhagen with a global outreach. The world has had a massive push towards more sustainable and ethical resourcing; Responsibly has created a service for buyers to evaluate each supplier in one place. Their service gives transparency on supply chains, providing updated ratings and statistics on their performance in terms of environmental impact, diversity, human rights, and financial risk. The product had a solid mission and needed a website and digital product design to ensure its success in a competitive market.
Our Design Thinking:
With such a large amount of complex and vital data to break down visually, we needed to develop an intelligent solution to deliver the data. This was the perfect challenge for our experienced team to utilise visual elements so that the user is not overwhelmed by data  .We worked responsibly to re-design their product, crafting a clean, easily digestible dashboard and sub-pages through efficient UX and UI. We also re-designed and built their website, including custom infographics and animations to articulate the product clearly.

‍
Finished Product: The result has been a successful boost in Responsibly's customer base, and the website and product we designed are still in use today. At Shoreditch we appreciate working on projects that aim for a more sustainable and ethical future in business, so we enjoyed our contribution to Responsibly's service.

Name: Road to Amherst
Summary: Revolutionising Road to Amherst: AI-driven branding and web redesign
Overview: "Embrace AI in the right way" is the guiding principle of Road to Amherst, independent strategy consultants specialising in Artificial Intelligence. We built their brand from the ground up, crafting a new identity and digital presence that aligns with their values and vision. By leveraging AI to create bespoke image assets, we delivered a design that speaks to their mission of helping businesses unlock AI's true potential in an innovative, impactful way.
Our Design Thinking:
When Road to Amherst approached us, they needed a design that captured the core values and vision driving their work. We embraced a clean, minimal aesthetic, using white space and subtly rounded corners to create a sense of clarity, modernity, and professionalism.

To bring the brand’s vision to life, we used AI-generated imagery that embodies themes of opportunity, risk analysis, and innovation. This dynamic imagery added depth and colour, complementing the overall clean aesthetic. The colour palette, rooted in White and Cool Grey with subtle Vermillion highlights, was chosen to maintain professionalism while still feeling fresh and innovative.

The logo and typography work together to create a cohesive identity that feels both established and youthful, ensuring that Road to Amherst’s mission, “Embrace AI in the right way”, is communicated clearly across every touchpoint. This approach sets Road to Amherst apart from larger consultancies, conveying their expertise in AI strategy while maintaining a modern, approachable, and forward-thinking presence.
Finished Product: The redesigned Road to Amherst website and brand blends innovation and elegance seamlessly. With its refined brand identity and impactful AI-driven imagery, the site communicates the company’s expertise and vision clearly. The modern aesthetic effectively highlights their mission to help businesses unlock AI’s true potential.

Name: Roil
Summary: Brand Identity for Eco-Conscience Car Enthusiasts
Overview: Roil Motor Club is a modern day rewards app for EV drivers. Drivers earn social and financial rewards for charging at optimal times of the day.
Our Design Thinking: We researched the typical Roil customer profile and developed a unique, brand identity that really stood out from the current EV market.
Finished Product: We worked with Roil to create the branding and identity for their EV Motor Club. The brand specialised in eco-friendly motor vehicles and was keen to represent all the energy sources in the logo's colours: nuclear (Neon Green), hydro (Teal), solar (Yellow), and wind (Blue).

Name: Rootana
Summary: Web design for a revolutionary meal supplement
Overview: Rootana is more than just a meal supplement; it helps shake up your diet and provides vital nutrients to avoid the “2pm slump”. Their powder becomes a creamy, delicious shake crafted by expert nutritionists to achieve the perfect macronutrient balance.
Our Design Thinking: With a product that was so carefully crafted, we wanted to make sure that their website conveyed the same amount of care. We took inspiration from the brand’s mission to best represent the product as wholesome, natural, nutritious and, most importantly, with a mouthwatering taste. After thorough research on the competitive market, SDS understood how to set it apart from the others.
Finished Product: Our team worked to make design decisions that reflected Rootana as a brand, including simplified and approachable infographics to show nutritional information. Our colour choices and image use genuinely reflect the whole. The website has just launched, and we couldn’t be more excited for them to help more people live healthier lives.

Name: Rule the roost
Summary: Scorekeeping app for competitive friends and families
Overview: Rule the Roost is a fun little app to help it’s users record the scores of games between friends and families. We designed and built it in record time to get it out during the heights of the pandemic.
Our Design Thinking: The concept for the app was formed in the heights of the pandemic, after finding that we were spending more and more time playing games with our housemates. As a competitive bunch, we were finding we couldn’t keep track of who was leading the pack as the weeks rolled into months. As a solution we designed Rule the Roost, as a super simple, fun and bubbly app to take scores between friends and families.
Finished Product: We managed to design and build the app in under two months. Keeping the feature set ultra-refined and the UI system built on repeatable for variable components. The result is a super simple but slick app which was featured by The Apple App Store!

Name: SBG
Summary: Specialist performance analysis software for teams and officials in the sporting field
Overview: SBG Sports Software develops a wide range of software applications for performance analysis, officiating and fan engagement for live events.
Our Design Thinking: We helped SBG provide pitwalls in Formula 1 teams a more efficient UI and UX experience when operating rapidly changing data. Moreover, we designed a product for camera angle management for the likes of football game.
Finished Product: SBG’s biggest design challenge lies in presenting a lot of data and graphics in a small viewport at any one time. To assist in this, we pushed their design system in Sketch to increase contrast and legibility.

Name: Scratcher
Summary: Embrace the power of gamification
Overview: Based in Copenhagen, Scratcher is a leading digital marketing company that specialises in gamification. With a team of a little over 20 people, Scratcher has built an award-winning platform that is now being used in over 12 different countries across the globe.
Our Design Thinking: Since the company was founded in 2017, Scratcher has already established itself as a leader in marketing gamification. However, with all that success, comes a responsibility to stay ahead of customer needs and expectations. The company must constantly learn, develop, and improve on their flagship product; otherwise the risk of falling behind. This is where we came in.
Finished Product: Even though we worked with Scratcher for only 4 months, we managed to achieve a lot in that time. First diving into market and competitor research, as well as current and future design trends, we designed a brand, not only suitable for their target audience, but also one that reflects Scratcher as a company. After the brand guidelines were developed and set up, we started with Product Design. Working alongside their developers and CEO, we carried out some extensive UX research while designing a versatile UI component library.

Name: Skrap
Summary: Designing the Uber for construction vehicle hire
Overview: Skrap is a London-based company that is revolutionising construction vehicle procurement. Whether you need a skip, cherry picker, portal or crane, Scrap allows its customers to book construction vehicles on demand for their sites across the UK. We worked with the founders and development team to overhaul their website and platform, encompassing a web app admin panel and a mobile app.
Our Design Thinking: We wanted to give the world of construction a bubbly and friendly veneer rather than fall into the stereotypes of hard edges and slab serif fonts. Taking inspiration from booking platform behemoths like Airbnb and Uber, we designed a unicolour UI with UX flows that are completely customisable by the user.
Finished Product: We worked with Scrap for over a year and embedded our design team directly with their product development team. If you are after a similar working approach, either as a stopgap before hiring in-house or as a replacement for using freelancers, get in touch. We love true partnerships like we have with Scrap!

Name: Smart Protein
Summary: Better. Healthier. Stronger.
Overview: Smart Protein initially came to us to redesign their eCommerce website, where users can buy high-quality fitness and workout products to promote a better, healthier and stronger lifestyle. Their product range includes a variety of Protein Powders, Pre/Post Workout Powders and diverse health and well-being supplements. All this while retaining a core protein range with an increased focus on function and benefits. They are dedicated to bringing its users high-quality wellness products at a competitive price.
Our Design Thinking: Smart Protein rebranded its product line, and the new gradients introduced were very appealing, which is why we’ve utilised them across the website in key areas to make it look cool, fun and engaging to users. Considering the target audience, along with a neutral base to let the gradients do the talking, we also introduced stats and testimonials to increase product credibility as well as motivational headlines. Smart Protein is interested in its users and wants to offer a seamless and trustworthy experience, so the introduction of a quiz, along with other great features, emphasises the idea of the brand wanting to personalise the journey of existing but also possible users so they achieve their goals as quickly and as efficiently as possible.
Finished Product: Their goal is to include everyone in their market. However, their key target is females 25-45 with an interest in health, fitness and wellbeing from a lifestyle perspective as opposed to high-performance athletes. This means they want the brand to be aspirational but within reach of everyday consumers. Smart Protein’s goal with the platform was to be more accessible, trustworthy and engaging.

Name: Snowball
Summary: Brand design for a new Canadian VC fund
Overview: Snowball is a new Canadian Venture Capitalist (or VC for short) founded in the deep north of Edmonton, Alberta. We were approached by the founders to create a unique brand for their latest venture. They already chose the name Snowball and a vision of how it could be a metaphor for accumulating wealth with their funds and investments. Shoreditch came in to visualise this concept, and over a short design sprint, we turned their ideas into reality.
Our Design Thinking: We were keen from the offset to visually integrate ideas of growth, accumulation, movement and the Snowball itself. The result is a dynamic snowflake mark created from arrows formed to look like a rolling movement. We paired this with a stripped-down colour palette to fit the corporate roots and a wordmark that emulated the tech companies the VC wanted to partner with.
Finished Product: Over 2 weeks, we created an entirely new brand and delivered annotated brand guidelines for the Snowball team to work with. If you are interested in creating a new brand or revisiting your existing one get in touch!

Name: Speech Graphics
Summary: Bringing AI to Life: Dynamic Video Showcase for Virtual voice Assistant
Overview: We crafted a dynamic 60-second video to showcase the capabilities of Rapport, a cutting-edge platform designed for creating real-time, emotionally expressive digital characters   Our goal was to highlight how their technology brings virtual characters to life with emotionally expressive animations, enhancing user interactions. We crafted a visually engaging narrative that demonstrated the assistant’s ability to seamlessly animate speech, incorporating non-verbal cues like breathing, blinks, and eye movement. By blending avatar personalities with vibrant graphics, we emphasized the platform’s power to deliver natural, multilingual interactions in real time. The final video effectively captured Rapport’s innovative edge, presenting a compelling visual story that demonstrated the platform’s ability to transform digital conversations.
Our Design Thinking: Our goal for this project was to bring the interactive avatars to life through a visually engaging narrative. Building on the client’s initial visual direction, we refined and elevated the design to achieve a polished and dynamic aesthetic. We explored creative possibilities with abstract design elements, vibrant gradients, and carefully crafted styleframes. A key focus was seamlessly integrating provided stock footage with custom graphics, resulting in a cohesive and visually striking piece that effectively conveyed the story's message.t
Finished Product: For Rapport, our goal was more than just creating a video – it was about capturing the essence of their groundbreaking technology. We used bold design choices and visually striking animations to bring the AI voice assistant’s personality to life. By blending captivating avatars with rich graphics, we crafted a narrative that emphasizes both the power and the human-like qualities of the platform. The end result is a polished, high-energy video that perfectly reflects Rapport's cutting-edge technology, setting it apart in the world of interactive AI.

Name: Sportbuff
Summary: Real-time fan engagement, gamification and monetisation of audiences
Overview: Sport Buff is a real-time fan engagement extension that uses gamification to engage audiences throughout the world of sports. Having the ability to be installed on mobile phones, tablets and desktops, as well as being integrated with streaming services such as Twitch, the product is a white label which empowers partners to create unique moments and retain viewers like never before.
Our Design Thinking: Working closely with the in-house web, iOS and Android developers, we introduced a versatile design system that would act as the foundation for each client, across all platforms, with ease and the ability to switch between dark and light modes. Our work with Sport Buff helped them win several high-profile clients in the world of football, eSports, basketball, cricket and many more. As well as the design system, Sport Buff asked us to look at upgrading the design of their Content Management System to allow for adding new features and aligning with the latest mobile strategies.
Finished Product:
Due to the increased popularity and ambition of the company, the owners thought the current user interface was good but not to a standard that would help support their increasing client portfolio and achieve their business goals. Sport Buff approached Shoreditch Design Studio to initially research how their Version 1.0 could be improved. This project, being on multiple devices as well as an extension, proved to be a challenging one. The UX research here was integral to the design process and couldn’t be rushed. Due to the size of the project and where the final product was to be presented, we had to be constantly aware of the amount of space on the screen that the extension was taking up, sometimes on minimal dimensions. A lot of user testing and interviews were necessary to start any of the UI work.

Once this research was in place, we designed the UI components, keeping in mind that this is a white-label product. Therefore, whatever we create must fit all of Sports Buff’s future clients. A challenging task. But how did we achieve this? Through the creation of a white-label UI component design system.

Name: Spyscape
Summary: Uncover your spy superpowers
Overview: SPYSCAPE is a New York based contemporary museum that aims to immerse its public in spy and superhero narratives through diverse galleries and experiences. Based on their pre-established branding, we were asked to adapt their visual language to a new website, ad style and pitch deck design while respecting its guidelines to keep a strong and instantly recognisable brand.
Our Design Thinking: We were asked to represent SPYSCAPE’s spy and superhero experience without falling into the typical stereotypical dark theme schemes. To achieve a future tech spy vibe, we incorporated minimal yet colourful elements and highlights.
Finished Product: We achieved and are still ongoing with a series of outputs across digital platforms, showcasing the Spyscape experience in a fresh, futuristic style that appeals to its audience in NYC and across the globe.

Name: Stocky
Summary: The handy Saas product thats taking the heavy lifting out of kitchen management
Overview: Stocky is a first in industry, SaaS product to reduce food waste and stress in the food industry. In a nutshell… Stocky allows the user to add their stock, create recipes and menus, and build an accurate, in-depth production plan - giving the user the exact stock quantity, recipe breakdown, schedule and costs to make their kitchen run smoothly without waste or stress.
Our Design Thinking: With no existing brand or product, the design options for this project were endless. The brief: Keep it clean, positive and playful. Stylistically we made the brand bold and vibrant, using the colour palette sparingly across the product in accents and main CTAs whilst black and white keeps the rest of the content slick and easily digestible. With several complex functionalities and crucial data onboarding process to tackle, we worked hard on the UX and UI to ensure the user journeys were intuitive and as simple as possible. We pushed the brand further on the landing page, introducing bright sections, parallax scrolling and fun graphics and animations to captivate the user push conversions.
Finished Product:
In a 4 week sprint we designed the entire first version of stocky - a tight turn around but we embraced the challenge and successfully produced a clean and intuitive product, a fresh and vibrant brand, and a detailed and fun landing page.


‍

Name: Supplyvue

Name: Talamo
Summary: Dyslexia screening made accessible
Overview:
In the U.K., when a parent notices signs of reading difficulty or other dyslexia symptoms in their child, they are faced with two options. One is a complicated road to NHS appointments, which can take years, or going to a private healthcare specialist, which is often expensive. Talamo provides scientifically accurate online dyslexia screening tests at a low price. Testing for dyslexia young unlocks access to the proper support and guidance for a child to thrive in school and life. A service that has the potential to change the lives of children, Talamo needed a brand identity to help gain funding and successfully launch into the market.

‍
Our Design Thinking:
When Talamo came to us, they struggled to find something that clicked with their vision. Talamo wanted to break the stigmas around neurodivergence. So, conveying a sense of empowerment through their brand identity was essential.

We started with the logo and played with the idea of the logo being a brain - and created an abstract brain shape. We opted for a range of high-contrast colours for the colour palette to give an energised and playful feel. We chose a premade illustration pack to make their brand assets friendly. We customised the characters by adding geometric shapes. The final touch was creating bespoke icons in brand colours to give a custom feel on a budget.

We also helped the Talamo team by supporting some UI & design system work for their test.
Finished Product:
It was essential to the founders that we prioritise de-stigmatising neurodiversity in applications of their brand, as opposed to sticking to the more clinical-authority-driven products currently on the market. There was also a balance between recognising that diagnosis may not be a positive experience for everyone and delivering an underlying feeling of empowerment. Some members of the Shoreditch Design team have diagnoses of dyslexia or other learning difficulties,  so we understood their mission on a personal level and felt passionate about getting their message across.


The website has recently launched: check out Talamo today!

Name: Unabated
Summary: Reimagining Unabated’s sports betting desktop experience to an app
Overview:
Sports betting is evolving, and Unabated is leading the charge. They empower bettors with tools, insights, and education that go beyond the odds—offering a smarter, data-driven approach. But to stand out in a fiercely competitive market, they needed more than a great concept; they needed a platform that looked as sharp as it performed.

A product that not only aligns with their mission but has been met with glowing feedback from the client and their users alike.

Name: Virtual Run

Name: Voltis
Summary: Setting the standard for renewable energy with a complete design for Voltis
Overview:
To celebrate and relaunch the merge of Oak and Green and Livos Renewables, their new team contacted us to create an impactful and united fresh look.

Within a few weeks, we completed the complete brand + website package for Voltis and got their team ready for launch!

We started with a workshop to establish an energetic name to give the brand the vitality to match its ambitions. We then span out a whole new brand identity to help sell their goal of being the go-to investor in Solar farms in the UK. With a unique identity in place, we designed and built a new website and launched it

We brainstormed until we reached a name that was instantly identifiable as being part of the energy market but was snappy enough to suit the techy ambitions of this startup. Voltis.

The brand's visual identity had us thinking about the futuristic and electric nature of photovoltaic farms and the visual motif of the timeless energy the sun provides. With the animated logo mark, we wanted to create something that encompassed both the source of energy and the sun's rays but also the future ambition of the company to be more involved with wind turbines alongside their Solar array farms.

The next step was to choose a typeface (Aeonik) and a vibrant colour palette that balanced between the timeless earthy nature of the farms these PV panels sit on and the futuristic technology of the energy itself. We then paired with image and video choices that suitably matched the British countryside where most of their sites sit.

‍
Finished Product: Within a 10-week sprint, we managed to roll out a new name, brand identity and, complete website design and build. The client has been thrilled with the result, as seen by their full review below! "We are really pleased with Shoreditch Design Studio's excellent work on our company rebrand and new website design and build. The team at Shoreditch Design Studio has met tight deadlines, and we are really pleased with the final product. From initial concept meetings to making final amendments, the team has been fantastic at updating and communicating with us, making this process a very collaborative experience.

Name: Wise
Summary: Assisting the fintech unicorn with all things design
Overview:

Their success has culminated in them being recently publicly listed with an opening valuation of £8bn.

Summary: Full design and product for the all in One Web3 Wallet
Overview: Zeal has big plans to revolutionise the web3 wallet experience. With their extension and app integration, you can do everything crypto from a single platform. Using Zeal's platform to store, send, receive and trade crypto helps break down barriers and unnecessary complications.

One of the priorities for the product design has been optimising file management and ease of development handover.
